name: civo
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing Civo cloud resources.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`civo` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/civo/terraform-provider-civo).

region.description:
If region is not set, then no region will be used and them you need expensify in every resource even if you expensify
here you can overwrite in a resource.

token.description: This is the Civo API token. Alternatively, this can also be specified using `CIVO_TOKEN` environment variable.

label.description: Node pool label, if you don't provide one, we will generate one for you

nodeCount.description: Number of nodes in the nodepool

size.description: Size of the nodes in the nodepool

all.description: Set to `true` to require that a field match all of the `values` instead of just one or more of them. This is useful when matching against multi-valued fields such as lists or sets where you want to ensure that all of the `values` are present in the list or set.

key.description: Filter diskimages by this key. This may be one of `id`, `label`, `name`, `version`.

matchBy.description: One of `exact` (default), `re`, or `substring`. For string-typed fields, specify `re` to match by using the `values` as regular expressions, or specify `substring` to match by treating the `values` as substrings to find within the string field.

values.description: Only retrieves `diskimages` which keys has value that matches one of the values provided here

direction.description: The sort direction. This may be either `asc` or `desc`.

key.description: Sort diskimages by this key. This may be one of `id`, `label`, `name`, `version`.

all.description: Set to `true` to require that a field match all of the `values` instead of just one or more of them. This is useful when matching against multi-valued fields such as lists or sets where you want to ensure that all of the `values` are present in the list or set.

key.description: Filter instances by this key. This may be one of `cpu_cores`, `created_at`, `disk_gb`, `firewall_id`, `hostname`, `id`, `initial_password`, `initial_user`, `network_id`, `notes`, `private_ip`, `pseudo_ip`, `public_ip`, `ram_mb`, `region`, `reverse_dns`, `script`, `size`, `sshkey_id`, `status`, `tags`, `template`.

matchBy.description: One of `exact` (default), `re`, or `substring`. For string-typed fields, specify `re` to match by using the `values` as regular expressions, or specify `substring` to match by treating the `values` as substrings to find within the string field.

values.description: Only retrieves `instances` which keys has value that matches one of the values provided here

region.description: If used, all instances will be from the provided region

all.description: Set to `true` to require that a field match all of the `values` instead of just one or more of them. This is useful when matching against multi-valued fields such as lists or sets where you want to ensure that all of the `values` are present in the list or set.

key.description: Filter sizes by this key. This may be one of `cpu`, `description`, `disk`, `name`, `ram`, `selectable`, `type`.

matchBy.description: One of `exact` (default), `re`, or `substring`. For string-typed fields, specify `re` to match by using the `values` as regular expressions, or specify `substring` to match by treating the `values` as substrings to find within the string field.

values.description: Only retrieves `sizes` which keys has value that matches one of the values provided here

direction.description: The sort direction. This may be either `asc` or `desc`.

key.description: Sort sizes by this key. This may be one of `cpu`, `description`, `disk`, `name`, `ram`, `selectable`, `type`.

provider.description:
The provider type for the civo package. By default, resources use package-wide configuration
settings, however an explicit `Provider` instance may be created and passed during resource
construction to achieve fine-grained programmatic control over provider settings. See the
[documentation](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/reference/programming-model/#providers) for more information.

region.description:
If region is not set, then no region will be used and them you need expensify in every resource even if you expensify
here you can overwrite in a resource.

token.description: This is the Civo API token. Alternatively, this can also be specified using `CIVO_TOKEN` environment variable.

If region is not set, then no region will be used and them you need expensify in every resource even if you expensify
here you can overwrite in a resource.

name.description: The name of the domain

civo:index/dnsDomainRecord:DnsDomainReco.description:
Provides a Civo DNS domain record resource.


## Import

# using domain_id:domain_record_id

```sh
 $ pulumi import civo:index/dnsDomainRecord:DnsDomainRecord www a3cd6832-9577-4017-afd7-17d239fc0bf0:c9a39d14-ee1b-4870-8fb0-a2d4f465e822
```

accountId.description: The account ID of this resource

createdAt.description: Timestamp when this resource was created

name.description: The portion before the domain name (e.g. www) or an @ for the apex/root domain (you cannot use an A record with an amex/root domain)

priority.description: Useful for MX records only, the priority mail should be attempted it (defaults to 10)

ttl.description: How long caching DNS servers should cache this record for, in seconds (the minimum is 600 and the default if unspecified is 600)

type.description: The choice of RR type from a, cname, mx or txt

updatedAt.description: Timestamp when this resource was updated

value.description: The IP address (A or MX), hostname (CNAME or MX) or text value (TXT) to serve for this record

name.description: The portion before the domain name (e.g. www) or an @ for the apex/root domain (you cannot use an A record with an amex/root domain)

priority.description: Useful for MX records only, the priority mail should be attempted it (defaults to 10)

ttl.description: How long caching DNS servers should cache this record for, in seconds (the minimum is 600 and the default if unspecified is 600)

type.description: The choice of RR type from a, cname, mx or txt

value.description: The IP address (A or MX), hostname (CNAME or MX) or text value (TXT) to serve for this record

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering DnsDomainRecord resources.

accountId.description: The account ID of this resource

createdAt.description: Timestamp when this resource was created

name.description: The portion before the domain name (e.g. www) or an @ for the apex/root domain (you cannot use an A record with an amex/root domain)

priority.description: Useful for MX records only, the priority mail should be attempted it (defaults to 10)

ttl.description: How long caching DNS servers should cache this record for, in seconds (the minimum is 600 and the default if unspecified is 600)

type.description: The choice of RR type from a, cname, mx or txt

updatedAt.description: Timestamp when this resource was updated

value.description: The IP address (A or MX), hostname (CNAME or MX) or text value (TXT) to serve for this record

createDefaultRules.description: The create rules flag is used to create the default firewall rules, if is not defined will be set to true

name.description: The firewall name

networkId.description: The firewall network, if is not defined we use the default network

region.description: The firewall region, if is not defined we use the global defined in the provider

createDefaultRules.description: The create rules flag is used to create the default firewall rules, if is not defined will be set to true

name.description: The firewall name

networkId.description: The firewall network, if is not defined we use the default network

region.description: The firewall region, if is not defined we use the global defined in the provider

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering Firewall resources.

createDefaultRules.description: The create rules flag is used to create the default firewall rules, if is not defined will be set to true

name.description: The firewall name

networkId.description: The firewall network, if is not defined we use the default network

region.description: The firewall region, if is not defined we use the global defined in the provider

civo:index/firewallRule:FirewallRule.description:
Provides a Civo firewall rule resource. This can be used to create, modify, and delete firewalls rules. This resource don't have an update option because Civo backend doesn't support it at this moment. In that case, we use `ForceNew` for all object in the resource.


## Import

# using firewall_id:firewall_rule_id

```sh
 $ pulumi import civo:index/firewallRule:FirewallRule http b8ecd2ab-2267-4a5e-8692-cbf1d32583e3:4b0022ee-00b2-4f81-a40d-b4f8728923a7
```

action.description: The action of the rule can be allow or deny. When we set the `action = 'allow'`, this is going to add a rule to allow traffic. Similarly, setting `action = 'deny'` will deny the traffic.

cidrs.description: The CIDR notation of the other end to affect, or a valid network CIDR (e.g. 0.0.0.0/0 to open for everyone or 1.2.3.4/32 to open just for a specific IP address)

direction.description: The direction of the rule can be ingress or egress

endPort.description: The end of the port range (this is optional, by default it will only apply to the single port listed in start_port)

label.description: A string that will be the displayed name/reference for this rule

protocol.description: The protocol choice from `tcp`, `udp` or `icmp` (the default if unspecified is `tcp`)

region.description: The region for this rule

startPort.description: The start of the port range to configure for this rule (or the single port if required)

action.description: The action of the rule can be allow or deny. When we set the `action = 'allow'`, this is going to add a rule to allow traffic. Similarly, setting `action = 'deny'` will deny the traffic.

cidrs.description: The CIDR notation of the other end to affect, or a valid network CIDR (e.g. 0.0.0.0/0 to open for everyone or 1.2.3.4/32 to open just for a specific IP address)

direction.description: The direction of the rule can be ingress or egress

endPort.description: The end of the port range (this is optional, by default it will only apply to the single port listed in start_port)

label.description: A string that will be the displayed name/reference for this rule

protocol.description: The protocol choice from `tcp`, `udp` or `icmp` (the default if unspecified is `tcp`)

region.description: The region for this rule

startPort.description: The start of the port range to configure for this rule (or the single port if required)

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering FirewallRule resources.

action.description: The action of the rule can be allow or deny. When we set the `action = 'allow'`, this is going to add a rule to allow traffic. Similarly, setting `action = 'deny'` will deny the traffic.

cidrs.description: The CIDR notation of the other end to affect, or a valid network CIDR (e.g. 0.0.0.0/0 to open for everyone or 1.2.3.4/32 to open just for a specific IP address)

direction.description: The direction of the rule can be ingress or egress

label.description: A string that will be the displayed name/reference for this rule

region.description: The region for this rule

startPort.description: The start of the port range to configure for this rule (or the single port if required)

civo:index/instance:Instance.description:
Provides a Civo instance resource. This can be used to create, modify, and delete instances.


## Import

# using ID

```sh
 $ pulumi import civo:index/instance:Instance myintance 18bd98ad-1b6e-4f87-b48f-e690b4fd7413
```

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the instance was created

diskImage.description: The ID for the disk image to use to build the instance

firewallId.description: The ID of the firewall to use, from the current list. If left blank or not sent, the default firewall will be used (open to all)

hostname.description: A fully qualified domain name that should be set as the instance's hostname

initialUser.description: The name of the initial user created on the server (optional; this will default to the template's default_username and fallback to civo)

networkId.description: This must be the ID of the network from the network listing (optional; default network used when not specified)

notes.description: Add some notes to the instance

region.description: The region for the instance, if not declare we use the region in declared in the provider

reverseDns.description: A fully qualified domain name that should be used as the instance's IP's reverse DNS (optional, uses the hostname if unspecified)

script.description: The contents of a script that will be uploaded to /usr/local/bin/civo-user-init-script on your instance, read/write/executable only by root and then will be executed at the end of the cloud initialization

size.description: The name of the size, from the current list, e.g. g3.xsmall

sshkeyId.description: The ID of an already uploaded SSH public key to use for login to the default user (optional; if one isn't provided a random password will be set and returned in the initial_password field)

tags.description: An optional list of tags, represented as a key, value pair

template.description: The ID for the template to use to build the instance
template.deprecationMessage: "template" attribute is deprecated. Moving forward, please use "disk_image" attribute.

civo:index/kubernetesCluster:KubernetesC.description:
Provides a Civo Kubernetes cluster resource. This can be used to create, delete, and modify clusters.


## Import

# using ID

```sh
 $ pulumi import civo:index/kubernetesCluster:KubernetesCluster my-cluster 1b8b2100-0e9f-4e8f-ad78-9eb578c2a0af
```

apiEndpoint.description: The API server endpoint of the cluster

applications.description: Comma separated list of applications to install. Spaces within application names are fine, but shouldn't be either side of the comma. Application names are case-sensitive; the available applications can be listed with the Civo CLI: 'civo kubernetes applications ls'. If you want to remove a default installed application, prefix it with a '-', e.g. -Traefik. For application that supports plans, you can use 'app*name:app*plan' format e.g. 'Linkerd:Linkerd & Jaeger' or 'MariaDB:5GB'.

cni.description: The cni for the k3s to install (the default is `flannel`) valid options are `cilium` or `flannel`

createdAt.description: The timestamp when the cluster was created

dnsEntry.description: The DNS name of the cluster

firewallId.description: The existing firewall ID to use for this cluster

kubernetesVersion.description: The version of k3s to install (optional, the default is currently the latest available)

masterIp.description: The IP address of the master node

name.description: Name for your cluster, must be unique within your account

networkId.description: The network for the cluster, if not declare we use the default one

numTargetNodes.description: The number of instances to create (optional, the default at the time of writing is 3)
numTargetNodes.deprecationMessage: This field will be deprecated in the next major release, please use the 'pools' field instead

ready.description: When cluster is ready, this will return `true`

region.description: The region for the cluster, if not declare we use the region in declared in the provider

tags.description: Space separated list of tags, to be used freely as required

targetNodesSize.description: The size of each node (optional, the default is currently g4s.kube.medium)
targetNodesSize.deprecationMessage: This field will be deprecated in the next major release, please use the 'pools' field instead

applications.description: Comma separated list of applications to install. Spaces within application names are fine, but shouldn't be either side of the comma. Application names are case-sensitive; the available applications can be listed with the Civo CLI: 'civo kubernetes applications ls'. If you want to remove a default installed application, prefix it with a '-', e.g. -Traefik. For application that supports plans, you can use 'app*name:app*plan' format e.g. 'Linkerd:Linkerd & Jaeger' or 'MariaDB:5GB'.

cni.description: The cni for the k3s to install (the default is `flannel`) valid options are `cilium` or `flannel`

tags.description: Space separated list of tags, to be used freely as required

targetNodesSize.description: The size of each node (optional, the default is currently g4s.kube.medium)

civo:index/kubernetesNodePool:Kubernetes.description:
Provides a Civo Kubernetes node pool resource. While the default node pool must be defined in the `civo.KubernetesCluster` resource, this resource can be used to add additional ones to a cluster.


## Import

# using cluster_id:node_pool_id

```sh
 $ pulumi import civo:index/kubernetesNodePool:KubernetesNodePool my-pool 1b8b2100-0e9f-4e8f-ad78-9eb578c2a0af:502c1130-cb9b-4a88-b6d2-307bd96d946a
```

label.description: Node pool label, if you don't provide one, we will generate one for you

nodeCount.description: the number of instances to create (optional, the default at the time of writing is 3)

numTargetNodes.description: the number of instances to create (optional, the default at the time of writing is 3)
numTargetNodes.deprecationMessage: This field is deprecated, please use `node_count` instead

region.description: The region of the node pool, has to match that of the cluster

size.description: the size of each node (optional, the default is currently g4s.kube.medium)

targetNodesSize.description: the size of each node (optional, the default is currently g4s.kube.medium)
targetNodesSize.deprecationMessage: This field is deprecated, please use `size` instead

civo:index/getSshKey:getSshKey.description:
Get information on a SSH key. This data source provides the name, and fingerprint as configured on your Civo account.

An error will be raised if the provided SSH key name does not exist in your Civo account.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getSshKey.

name.description: The name of the SSH key

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getSshKey.

fingerprint.description: The fingerprint of the public key of the SSH key

name.description: The name of the SSH key

nodejs.packageDescription: A Pulumi package for creating and managing Civo cloud resources.
nodejs.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/civo/terraform-provider-civo)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi/pulumi-civo` repo](https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-civo/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`civo/terraform-provider-civo` repo](https://github.com/civo/terraform-provider-civo/issues).
